%md ![ntu logo] ## [機器學習基石 (Machine Learning Foundations)] ![course logo] ### Instructor [prof. Hsuan-Tien Lin] Co-authored [Learning from Data A Short Course], which is available for sale on Amazon, and is consistently one of the best sellers. To access the e-Chapters, go to the book forum e-Chapter section: User Name: bookreaders Password: Enter the first word on page 27 of the book.
ACM SigKDD (Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining) Competitions * the third place of KDDCup 2009 slow track * the champion of KDDCup 2010, * the double-champion of the two tracks in KDDCup 2011 * the champion of track 2 in KDDCup 2012 * the double-champion of the two tracks in KDDCup 2013. [prof. Hsuan-Tien Lin]: http://www.csie.ntu.edu.tw/~htlin/ [Learning from Data A Short Course]: http://www.amazon.com/Learning-From-Data-Yaser-Abu-Mostafa/dp/1600490069 [機器學習基石 (Machine Learning Foundations)]: https://www.coursera.org/course/ntumlone [course logo]: https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/api/utilities/v1/imageproxy/https://d15cw65ipctsrr.cloudfront.net/3f/b6d4d0352b11e494bcf927fb09cbc9/logo.png [prof. 機器學習基石 (Machine Learning Foundations)

Instructor

prof. Hsuan-Tien Lin

Co-authored Learning from Data A Short Course, which is available for sale on Amazon, and is consistently one of the best sellers.

To access the e-Chapters, go to the book forum e-Chapter section:
User Name: bookreaders
Password: Enter the first word on page 27 of the book.


ACM SigKDD (Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining) Competitions

  • the third place of KDDCup 2009 slow track
  • the champion of KDDCup 2010,
  • the double-champion of the two tracks in KDDCup 2011
  • the champion of track 2 in KDDCup 2012
  • the double-champion of the two tracks in KDDCup 2013.

paragraphs.text:
%md  
## Course Overview

[mooc outline, slides, video]

[mooc outline, slides, video]: http://www.csie.ntu.edu.tw/~htlin/mooc/

%md
### What is Machine Learning
Learning: Acquiring skill from experience accumulated from observations.
Machine Learning: Acquiring skill with experience accumulated/computed from data.   

Skill: improve some performance measurement, e.g. predication accuracy.   

=> Machine Learning: improving some performance measure with experience computed from data.  

![ML definition][1]
[1]: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rkuo/Zeppelin-Notebooks/master/images/What_Is_ML_Definition.png

### ML Use Cases
* Computational Finance: stock data -> ML -> more investment gain.

### Why ML?
* don't know how to define a solution, e.g. visual/speech recognition.
* human cannot program the system manually, e.g. we need to design a navigation system on Mars, but we do not know what kind of environment the rover will encounte.
* need rapid decision that requires large amount data analysis, and human just can not do it fast enough, e.g. stock market trading.
* need to create customer-targeted marketing for massive scale, e.g. recommendation engine.

### Key Essentials
Difference between Data Mining and Machine Learning:
* Data Mining: Search thru huge amount of data to find interesting property or information.
* Machine Learning: Use data to compute hypothesis, g, that approximate to target function, f.
* ML is very similar to DM. DM is to find interesting property **same as** hypothesis that approximate to target.  ML is to find interesting property **related to** hypothesis that approximate to target.

result.msg:
What is Machine Learning

Learning: Acquiring skill from experience accumulated from observations.
Machine Learning: Acquiring skill with experience accumulated/computed from data.

Skill: improve some performance measurement, e.g. predication accuracy.

=> Machine Learning: improving some performance measure with experience computed from data.

ML Use Cases

  • Computational Finance: stock data -> ML -> more investment gain.

Why ML?

  • don't know how to define a solution, e.g. visual/speech recognition.
  • human cannot program the system manually, e.g. we need to design a navigation system on Mars, but we do not know what kind of environment the rover will encounte.
  • need rapid decision that requires large amount data analysis, and human just can not do it fast enough, e.g. stock market trading.
  • need to create customer-targeted marketing for massive scale, e.g. recommendation engine.

Key Essentials

Difference between Data Mining and Machine Learning:

  • Data Mining: Search thru huge amount of data to find interesting property or information.
  • Machine Learning: Use data to compute hypothesis, g, that approximate to target function, f.
  • ML is very similar to DM. DM is to find interesting property same as hypothesis that approximate to target. ML is to find interesting property related to hypothesis that approximate to target.
